author: Epoch Video
description: President Donald Trump responds to Hamas’s acceptance of his peace plan at 6:30 p.m. ET on Oct. 3.
title: LIVE NOW: Trump Responds to Hamas’s Acceptance of His Peace Plan

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Gatherings are planned in more than 300 locations across the country on Oct. 5 in support of an annual pro-life event that advocates for legal and cultural change to protect human life at all stages. This year marks the 35th annual Life Chain demonstration in Canada, which is organized by Campaign Life Coalition (CLC), a […]
title: Pro-Life Demonstration Set to Take Place Across Canada This Weekend

author: Olivia Gomm
description: TORONTO—A B.C.-based drug policy researcher warns that exaggerating symptoms, a phenomenon he says has become more common, could lead to the overprescription of medications and cause unnecessary harms and side effects. Drug policy researcher Alan Cassels called this type of exaggeration “disease mongering,” while speaking at an Oct. 3 conference hosted by the International Society […]
title: ‘Disease Mongering’: Drug Policy Researcher Warns About Perils of Exaggerating Symptoms

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Steak, roasts, and ground beef jump more than 12 percent in the United States, far outpacing broader food inflation, data show.
title: Beef Prices Rise to Record High Amid Tight Supply From Shrinking US Cattle Herds

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Senate is no longer allowing senators to be reimbursed for spouses receiving language training. The changes were passed yesterday at a Senate committee meeting on internal economy, budgets and administration. The changes were made after Radio-Canada reported this week that Quebec Sen. Amina Gerba billed taxpayers nearly $22,000 for two English-language training courses in […]
title: Senate Curbs Spending on Language Training, Spousal Travel

author: The Canadian Press
description: Marineland has asked Ottawa for emergency funding to feed and care for its whales, saying euthanasia is otherwise imminent. Fisheries Minister Joanne Thompson earlier this week denied Marineland’s request to export 30 belugas to Chimelong Ocean Kingdom, an aquarium in China. The Niagara Falls, Ont., tourist attraction says Chimelong was the only option for the […]
title: Marineland Asks Ottawa for Emergency Cash to Feed Whales—or Euthanasia Imminent

author: The Canadian Press
description: A former Montreal police investigator warns that more violence could follow this week’s shooting at a Starbucks north of the city, as the victim was formally identified as an organized crime figure. Charalambos Theologou, 40, died in the mid-morning shooting at a commercial plaza in Laval, Que. that also left two other people wounded, Quebec’s […]
title: Expect Retaliation After Starbucks Shooting of Organized Crime Figure, Expert Says

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Parks Canada has issued a grizzly bear warning for popular hiking and camping areas in Banff National Park near the Alberta-B.C. border, after a bear with a history of encounters with visitors was reported frequenting the region. The federal agency issued the warning for the park areas of Arnica Lake, Vista Lake, Twin Lakes, Gibbon […]
title: Grizzly Bear Warning Issued for Popular Banff Hiking and Camping Area

author: Emel Akan
description: Hamas agreed to some terms in the U.S. president’s Gaza peace plan but sought more negotiation on others.
title: Hamas Says It Agrees to Release All Hostages After Trump’s Ultimatum

author: Chandra Philip
description: A Chinese manufacturer of robotic toys accused by U.S. authorities of collecting kids’ geolocation information for a third party without parental consent has also been selling the products in Canada. Toymaker Apitor Technology Co. was accused last month by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) of violating the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act. The act […]
title: Chinese Toymaker Accused of Collecting Data on Children in US Also Sold Products in Canada

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A global banking alliance founded by Prime Minister Mark Carney in 2021 to prioritize lending and investment to meet net-zero emissions targets has voted to end its operations. The U.N.-backed Net-Zero Banking Alliance (NZBA) says members voted to end the membership-based structure and instead use the climate guidance the group created as a reference. The […]
title: Net-Zero Banking Alliance Founded by Mark Carney Votes to Dissolve

author: The Canadian Press
description: The second phase of strikes by Montreal’s public transit maintenance workers is coming to an end, but there is still no deal in sight. The latest strike by about 2,400 workers began Sept. 22 and is scheduled to end this weekend. Over two weeks metro and bus service was limited to rush hours on Mondays, […]
title: Negotiations at an Impasse as Second Phase of Transit Strikes in Montreal Nears End

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Kyiv formally requested the Tomahawks, and U.S. Vice President JD Vance confirmed the U.S. government is reviewing the request.
title: Putin Says US Tomahawk Supply to Kyiv Would Be Dangerous Escalation

author: The Canadian Press
description: G7 foreign ministers are set to gather near Niagara Falls next month for two days of meetings. Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand will host her colleagues from France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the U.K., the U.S. and the European Union. Global Affairs Canada says the meeting will take place “in the Niagara Region” of Ontario on […]
title: Anand Set to Host Fellow G7 Foreign Ministers in November Near Niagara Falls

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Meanwhile, UK Space Command and UK Space Agency announced a new project to detect lasers being used against British satellites.
title: Russia Targeting British Military Satellites on a Weekly Basis, Says Head of UK Space Command

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis U.S. Secretary of War Pete Hegseth is unlikely to approve of the sight of a Canadian soldier’s authorized long hair and purple goatee. Hegseth made it abundantly clear during a speech this week given in front of essentially all of the U.S. military’s top brass assembled in Quantico, Virginia that grooming standards in […]
title: The Diverging Cultural Paths of American and Canadian Militaries

author: Matthew Lau
description: Commentary We are now several weeks into the new school year, which exposes hundreds of thousands of children to systemic racism. Or at least, that’s according to the Ontario Human Rights Commission (OHRC). As I show in a new report for the Aristotle Foundation, the commission’s new action plan is deeply flawed. Here are just […]
title: New Claims of ‘Systemic Anti-Black Racism’ in Ontario Schools Lack Any Real Evidence

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Conservatives are criticizing federal immigration procedures after a Pakistani man was granted a Canadian visitor’s visa in 2023 despite being registered as a sex offender in the UK for sexually abusing his underage niece. Tory MP Michelle Rempel Garner criticized Justice Minister Sean Fraser for allowing “a publicly-listed incestuous child sex abuser into Canada” during […]
title: Tories Demand Answers After Pakistani Man on UK Sex-Offender List Allowed Into Canada

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ottawa’s financial watchdog is reporting considerable progress in narrowing the national housing affordability gap, but the situation appears markedly different throughout the country. Canada’s housing gap shrank from 80 percent in September 2023 to 34 percent in August thanks to reduced borrowing costs, increased wages, and declining home prices, an updated housing report from Parliamentary […]
title: Budget Watchdog Finds Gains in Housing Affordability, but Some Areas Still Struggling

author: Epoch Video
description: Members of the Jewish community hold a vigil on Oct. 3 in Manchester after two were killed in an attack at a local synagogue.
title: REPLAY: Manchester Jewish Community Holds Vigil After Synagogue Attack

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The incident follows a number of similar drone sightings above European airports and caused disruption at the busy German hub ahead of a public holiday.
title: Drones Shut Down Munich Airport in Latest Incursion of EU Airspace

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced he will travel to Washington, D.C., on Oct. 7, to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump for a “working visit.” A release from the Prime Minister’s Office said the visit will be focused on “shared priorities in a new economic and security relationship between Canada and the U.S.” Both Canada […]
title: Carney to Meet With Trump in Washington on Oct. 7

author: Jackson Richman
description: Trump announced this in a post on Truth Social on Oct. 3.
title: Trump Sets Sunday Deadline for Hamas to Accept Peace Deal

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The Supreme Court told the government to reassess its 2016 license within six weeks, leaving exports suspended.
title: Dutch Court Orders Review of F-35 Fighter Jet Parts Exports to Israel

author: Chris Summers
description: Greater Manchester Police say the terrorist attacker did not have a gun on him and that the only shots were fired by authorized firearms officers.
title: UK Synagogue Attack: Police Believe They Shot Victim While Stopping Attacker

author: The Canadian Press
description: An election employee noted a discrepancy in the postal codes of special ballot return envelopes in Terrebonne nearly three weeks before the election, but the error wasn’t reported to superiors. The mistake is outlined in legal documents filed as part of a court action brought by a former Bloc Québécois member who lost in the […]
title: Terrebonne One-Vote Win: Postal Code Error on Envelope Unreported for Three Weeks

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: An indepedent journalism group from Malaysia has expressed grave concerns around the cross-border arrest.
title: Australian Scholar Faces Thai Court After Alleged Malaysian-Backed Cross-Border Arrest

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: MP Andrew Hastie has stepped down from his role as shadow home affairs spokesman, claiming he'd have been stopped from contributing to immigration policy.
title: Hastie Resigns as Shadow Home Affairs Minister After Internal Immigration Clash

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Telstra moved almost 9,000 customers to a plan with a slower upload speed without telling them.
title: Telstra Ordered to Pay $18 Million to Customers Switched to Lower Internet Speeds

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: More than 1,000 submissions have been made to a Queensland government inquiry on e-mobility devices.
title: Calls to Licence E-scooter Riders and Crack Down on Illegal Imports

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Frank Bainimarama, who seized power in a military coup in 2006, has been found guilty of threatening the Police Commissioner.
title: Former Fijian Prime Minister Found Guilty of Corruption

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Beijing's incursion into the region did not rate much of a mention from the Pacific leaders.
title: What Pacific Leaders Had to Say About Climate Change at the UN

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The alleged sighting near Maiquetia comes weeks after U.S. military strikes on Venezuelan-linked vessels tied to narcotrafficking.
title: Venezuela Alleges 5 US Fighter Jets Approached Its Coastline

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Jewish leaders say communities are having to take extraordinary measures for safety.
title: Victorian Police Step up Patrols in Jewish Areas After UK Synagogue Attack

author: PA Media
description: Almost half of adults (48 percent) in Great Britain have gambled in the last four weeks, according to an annual survey by the industry regulator. Some 2.7 percent of adults scored “8+” on the Problem Gambling Severity Index (PGSI) in 2024—up from 2.5 percent the previous year—which is “statistically stable” compared to the year before, […]
title: Half of British Adults Gambled in Last Month: Survey

author: PA Media
description: A new police boat is being deployed in Devon and Cornwall because of an anticipated surge in illegal immigration. The Home Office has funded the vessel as it is expected people smugglers will target the region as enforcement in the Channel intensifies. The number of migrant arrivals on small boats has topped 34,000 in 2025 […]
title: Police Launch New Boat to Deter People Smugglers

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Prime Minister Albanese described the attack as 'heinous.'
title: Australian Leaders Respond to Manchester Terrorist Attack on Synagogue

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A federal Conservative MP is condemning “cancel culture” after the B.C. Conservatives dropped a staffer over online comments about the National Day for Truth and Reconciliation. MP Aaron Gunn’s comments come after the recent firing of B.C. Conservative communications staffer Lindsay Shepherd, who says she was dismissed Oct. 1 as a result of a Sept. […]
title: Conservative MP, MLA Speak Out on Free Speech as BC Tories Expel Staffer

author: PA Media
description: Weather warnings for the first named storm of the season have been upgraded to amber for large parts of Scotland. The Met Office warned Storm Amy will bring a spell of “damaging winds” on Friday evening and overnight, with gusts of 95mph possible. Difficult driving conditions are expected, as well as disruption to ferry, air […]
title: Storm Amy Weather Warnings Upgraded to Amber

author: PA Media
description: A possible new cancer drug which researchers believe could be up to 500 times more effective than existing treatments is one of 18 projects being funded by a Scottish Government scheme that aims to encourage innovation. The new Proof of Concept fund will award cash to “groundbreaking research” being carried out at Scotland’s universities in a […]
title: Projects That Are ‘Life-Changing and Lifesaving’ to Receive Government Cash

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The CEO of Canada’s largest pipeline company is calling for the removal of the oil tanker ban off British Columbia’s northwest coast, saying it deters pipeline investment and holds back Canada’s economic potential. Enbridge CEO Gregory Ebel made the comments on Oct. 2 while addressing the Empire Club of Canada, a Canadian speakers’ forum, in […]
title: Enbridge CEO Calls for End to Tanker Ban Off BC Coast, Says It Discourages Pipeline Investment

author: Cindy Li
description: 'Today is not a day to celebrate but a day of mourning,' Debbie Wang says on Beijing's national day.
title: 30 Years After Fleeing the CCP Threat, Daughter Now Issues Warning to Australia

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: U.S. billionaire John Catsimatidis is urging the Supreme Court of Canada to allow U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) testing on a flock of ostriches subject to a cull order by Canadian officials since last December. The cull order from the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is currently stayed following a Supreme Court decision issued […]
title: American Billionaire Says Supreme Court Should Allow US Testing of BC Ostriches Before Culling
